Class EditorFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • guis.CSGFrame
                • guis.EditorFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class EditorFrame
extends CSGFrame
    The user can edit, modify game maps. Game map's size is customizable and progress can be saved and loaded with a press of a button. You can draw all types of tiles onto the canvas and then load in a custom map with the game.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  EditorFrame.SizeActionListener
      Forwards the resize of the window if the user wants to add more rows and columns of tiles.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EditorFrame

        public EditorFrame(javax.swing.JFrame callerFrame)
        The editor's main window. The user can create, save and modify a map.
        Parameters:
        callerFrame - the frame which initiated this window. It is used to go back to, when finished in the editor. (Not implemented.)

    • Method Detail

      • loadMap

        public void loadMap(GameMap gameMap)
        Loads in the map and refreshes the canvas.
        Specified by:
        loadMap in class CSGFrame
        Parameters:
        gameMap - the map which we load in.

      • saveMap

        public boolean saveMap(GameMap gameMap)
        Checks if it is safe to save the map. (Has all the rules met.)
        Specified by:
        saveMap in class CSGFrame
        Parameters:
        gameMap - the map to save.
        Returns:
        if succeed, will return TRUE. If the map has not met the necessary rules, then returns FALSE.

      • checkMapToSave

        private int checkMapToSave(GameMap gameMap)
        Checks how many rules a map broke.
        Parameters:
        gameMap - the map to check.
        Returns:
        Number of rules the map broke.

      • saveErrorLogger

        private void saveErrorLogger(GameMap gameMap,
                             javax.swing.JDialog errorDialog)
        Logs all the rules broken in the error's dialog window.
        Parameters:
        gameMap - map which broke the rules.
        errorDialog - the dialog to add error labels to.

      • setUpSaveLoad

        private void setUpSaveLoad()
        Sets up the save and load feature of the map. The user is able to save and load in a game map.

      • setUpToolBar

        private void setUpToolBar()
        On the toolbar are the brushes what enables the user to draw on the canvas. Every button represents a brush, every brush "draws" on the canvas a different way.

      • setUpCanvas

        private void setUpCanvas()
        Sets up the listeners and delegators so the user is able to draw onto the canvas.

      • setUpSizingTools

        private void setUpSizingTools()
        The sizing feature enables to size the game map however (within limits) the user wants. User can set the rows and columns on the game map.

      • setUpLayoutWest

        private void setUpLayoutWest()
        Placing the brush buttons onto the canvas. Located on the left side. Also sets the layout of the west panel.

      • setUpLayoutEast

        private void setUpLayoutEast()
        Setting up the canvas, which the user will draw onto. This canvas draws the game map in its current state (always).

      • setEditorFrameSize

        public void setEditorFrameSize(int columns,
                               int rows)
        Handles the resize process.
        Parameters:
        columns - the number of columns of tiles.
        rows - the number of rows of tiles.
